caseTitle: Secretary Establishment, Govt. of Pakistan, Islamabad v. Aftab Ahmed Manika & others
tagline: A plain reading of Section 9 of the Civil Servants Act, 1973 and Rule 7 of the Civil Servants (Appointment, Promotion and Transfer) Rules, 1973 makes it clear that the appointing Authority has to make promotions in BPS 20 and 21 only upon the recommendations of the Central Selection Board (CSB). It does not provide in either of the provision that the recommendations of CSB are binding and consequently be returned by the appointing Authority only when the procedure followed by CSB suffers from any factual or legal flaw.
